alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Dubuque (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:33PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Slow-moving thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Delaware and northwestern Dubuque Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 326 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking slow-moving thunderstorms from near Colesburg to Bankston. These storms were nearly stationary, and will have the potential to produce 2 to 3 inches of rain in a short period of time. This may lead to ponding water on roadways and minor flooding in low lying and poorly drained areas. At 301 PM CDT, Delaware County Emergency Management relayed a report of 1.2 inches of rainfall in the Petersburg area occurring in just 20 minutes. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Slowing or redirecting of traffic due to ponding or flowing water. Locations impacted include... Dyersville, Earlville, New Vienna, Colesburg, Holy Cross, Luxemburg, Rickardsville, Centralia, Bankston, Graf, Bankston Park, Cottage Hill, New Wine Park, Lattnerville, Twin Bridges Park, Petersburg, Five Points and Camp Little Cloud. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Stay away from flooded areas. Report any flooding to local law enforecement If the heavy rain continues, a flash flood warning may be needed.
